name: The Sylvan Legacy
description: In this piece, audience members use their smart devices to collectively control musical, visual, and narrative elements of this high fantasy choose-your-own-adventure work. Audience members choose character traits, decide which paths to travel, and determine how our heroes will respond in times of conflict.
tools: Node.js, Max, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Firebase

name: Audition Assistant
description: This app is an all in one music practice assistant. It features a multifunctional metronome, practice journal, and audition planner.
tools: Python, Django, React, PostgreSQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Materialize, Heroku, Howler.js, AWS S3, Open Opus API

name: Corpus Generator
description: The Corpus Generator is a full stack Flask App, interfacing with the Spotfiy API to collect data on songs based on user specified filters. This is helpful for generating a body of works to be used in corpus studies for musicologists, where the research is done by collection and analyzing  hundreds or thousands of songs. There are a lot of problems that make reliable corpus building very difficult and time consuming for researchers, so this tool will hopefully solve many of these problems.
tools: Python, Flask, Spotify API, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

name: ListenTO
description: Experimental musicians in Toronto are releasing amazing music. Click around and find something you like!
tools: React, MongoDB/Mongoose, Express, Node.js, HTML, CSS, Auth0, OpenAI API

name: Audio Granulator
description: A walkthrough video of how to make a simple audio granulator in C. This is an extension of code written fro CS50's Lab 4.

name: CS50 Lab 4 Walkthough
description: A descriptive walthrough of CS50's Volume problem

name: UFO Sighting Scraper
description: This application is a sophisticated web scraper specifically designed to extract and aggregate information from the National UFO Reporting Center (NUFORC) website. It efficiently handles asynchronous HTTP requests, capable of processing up to 1000 pages simultaneously, which is the upper limit before the website's throttling mechanisms activate. The core of this application lies in its ability to store and manage data in a JSON format, making it easily accessible and manipulable by future programs. Each entry in the JSON file contains detailed information about UFO sightings, including the date, time, location, a narrative description of the event, the shape of the observed craft, accompanying images, and a boolean value representing whether or not there are videos present in the entry.

name: N64 Button Tracker
description: This project is dedicated to tracking and visualizing button clicks in Super Smash Bros 64 matches. The primary goal is to gain insights into Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) within these matches and apply these insights to design an innovative, musically interactive performance piece. This interactive experience will take input from two players, creating a unique blend of gaming and musical expression.

name: Bat Buster
description: Bat Buster is a browser based arcade style game built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The user uses the mouse and keyboard to move the player character while avoiding and shooting oncoming swarms of bats.

name: Kindr
description: Kindr is a heartwarming app designed to inspire and spread kindness in your community and beyond. With Kindr, you can create and share meaningful good deeds for others to undertake, fostering a culture of compassion and positivity. Users can participate by completing deeds posted by fellow members or by taking on the daily challenge, making each day an opportunity to make the world a better place, one act of kindness at a time.
tools: React, MongoDB/Mongoose, Express, Node.js, HTML, CSS, Auth0, OpenAI API

name: Duo Cichorium
description: Portfolio for Toronto based multimedia ensemble Duo Cichorium

name: Jaz Tsui Portfolio
description: This website serves as a hub for documentation of the works by Toronto based multimedia artist Jasmine Tsui. Pared down full screen wireframes were designed by Jasmine and provided to me in order to create the website. We collaborated on the design and implementation over two months, leading to this final product. A refactor of the site into a React based SPA is currently in progress

name: The Happenstancers
description: Documentation hub for Toronto based chamber music ensemble The Happenstancers

name: Scenic Shenanigans
description: Scenic Shenanigans is a travel planner and journal. Users can add each other to various trips to plan activities and share photos with each other.
tools: Node.js, MongoDB/Mongoose, Express, HTML, CSS, OAuth2, OpenAI API

name: Here and There
description: Here and There by Roger Reynolds. Performed on March 13th, 2020 at Array Space, Toronto

name: Back to School
description: This was an improvised performance using no-input mixer, and some other instruments, which took place on September 19th 2024 at Bickford Park in Toronto. This was part of a concert in the Back To School concert series hosted by Ministry of Phonic Services.

name: All At Once
description: My first album, using no inpput mixer/equalizer, percussion, and various softwares

name: Omelas
description:
Omelas (2020) for vibraphone and voice
 
Performed by Joyce To
 
Text excerpted from Ursula K. LeGuin's The Ones Who Walk Away From Omelas

name: aproximations
description:
approximations by Molly Jones for accordion, percussion, and neural networks  is a collection of five short movements featuring the sounds of two audio-generating neural networks trained on the sounds of the two performers, Louis Pino and Matti Pulkki.  The neural networks (named The Accordionator and The Great Percussionist In The Sky by GPT-3) are AIs who have only ever had one sensory input: the sound of their assigned performer.  They’re quirky robots trying to imitate the performers who are, in turn, trying to interact with and imitate the robots.
May 19, 2023
Array Space, Toronto

name: Reach Through
description:
In Reach Through by Reilly Spitzfaden, the performers use a custom web app on their smartphones to send motion data to Max/MSP, as well as using microphones and small amplifiers as instruments to create feedback and other noises. In response to the performers’ gestures, the Max patch manipulates recordings of “cheesy” retro synthesizers in a way that imitates broken CDs and tapes, and plays back “databending” sounds (non-audio data treated as audio, which creates a detailed, crackling mixture of digital noise and pitch). These sounds of audio playback and/or storage media failing, and of retro 80s/90s synthesizers make me think about memory, nostalgia, and loss in a way I find aesthetically pleasing.
May 19, 2023
Array Space, Toronto

name: Elemental Suite
description:
The Elemental Suite is a multimedia performance co-created by myself and Jasmine Tsui of Duo Cichorium. It features four movements inspired by natural elements, employing diverse technologies:

Matchbox Ritual: Recycled drawers serve as percussion instruments, equipped with homemade piezo microphones and Arduinos. Max processes the microphone signal, allowing Arduinos to control three lamps for each performer in real-time, creating a dynamic lighting experience.

Morphogenesis: This movement showcases a handmade tree-like sculpture, vividly projected using OBS-based mapping. Each section (roots, trunk, foliage) and the performance space are individually projected upon, enhancing the visual impact.

Desiderium: Homemade hydrophones capture the sounds of water and instruments within it. These sounds are then fed into Ableton Live for amplification and live processing, creating a captivating auditory experience.

Scintillation: The final movement combines the MUGIC motion sensor, Arduino, and Max, enabling performers to control fans directed at wind chimes through gestures while playing percussion. The motion sensor data also influences various sound parameters, adding an interactive element to the performance.

name: MadLib
description: MadLib is a customizable composition for solo instrumentalist written in 2021. MadLib is specifically designed to engage fundamental skills to help performers think about the application of technological concepts from an artistic perspective

name: Anticommunication
description:
Composed by Jet Kye Chong 
Performed by Duo Cichorium (Jaz Tsui, Louis Pino)
February 8, 2024
Array Space, Toronto

name: 0 Damage Any % Reverse Glitch Speed Run
description: This piece invites audience members to play a live game of Super Smash Bros. 64. Button input from the players is captured and analyzed by Max to manipulate aspects of the electronic sound. The percussionists are each assigned a character to sonically represent in performance, creating a unified ensemble between the game players, percussionists, and electronics, all driven by gameplay.

name: Fall of the Empire
description: Composed by Frederic Rzewski

name: ∆ ▽ O ■ □ ● ○ ▲ ► ▼ ◄ ː ˑ
description:
Created and performed by 

Nina Harris, Michal Schorsch, Emily Young, Louise Wurzlebacher (movement)

Joshua Biggs, and Louis Pino (sound)

name: Where am I?
description: A collection of pieces using no-input mixer and various electronics. Where am I? attempts to blur the line between performer and instrument, using custom built electronics and biological sensors to incorporate the two into a single entity.

name: Three Roses
description: Three Roses is a quartet for percussion, incorporating 2 technological devices to give the performers control over lighting and sound design. First is the MUGIC, a gestural sensor developed by violinist Mari Kimura, which you can see on each of the players’ hands. Second is the Arduino which controls the lights, and through the software Max MSP can respond to the gestures of the performers captured by the MUGIC. This piece was commissioned by Aiyun Huang for the TaPIR lab in the early stages of COVID, and as such has gone through multiple iterations from live concert performance, to remote collaboration, and eventually settled as an in person recording project.
